required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Myosfascial Trigger-Points and Effects on Neuromuscular Response
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Myosfascial Trigger-Points of Gastrocnemius and Its Effects on the Neuromuscular Response

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to analyze the effects of the treatment of the Myosfascial Trigger-Points detected in the gastrocnemius muscles on the neuromuscular response.

primary_outcome.measure: change of neuromuscular stiffness of the gastrocnemious muscles
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes before the intervention, and 1 minute after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: biomechanical property of a muscle that characterizes the resistance to an external force that deforms its initial shape, using a "Myoton".

primary_outcome.measure: change of elasticity of the gastrocnemious muscles
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes before the intervention, and 1 minute after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Biomechanical property of a muscle that characterizes the ability to recover its initial shape after the removal of the external force that lead to its deformation, using a "Myoton".

primary_outcome.measure: change of relaxation of the gastrocnemious muscles
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes before the intervention, and 1 minute after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Time for a muscle to recover its shape from deformation after the removal of an external force, using a "Myoton".

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 minutes before the intervention, and 6 minute after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Active range of movement of the dorsiflexion of the ankle, using an inclinometer (degrees).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes before the intervention, and 8 minute after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Pasive range of movement of the dorsiflexion of the ankle, using an inclinometer (degrees).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes before the intervention, and 5 minute after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Isometric strength of the gastrocnemious muscles using a handheld dynamometer "microFET 2" (newtons).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 minutes before the intervention, and 2 minute after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: How much pressure needs to be applied to cause pain

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 minutes before the intervention, and 3 minute after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: How much pain the pacient reports while a pressure of 1kg/cm²/s is being applied over his gastrocnemious muscle

arm_group.description: Digitopressure treatment of the Myosfascial Trigger Points

intervention.description: Subjets receive digitopressure during 90 seconds for the treatment of the Myosfascial Trigger Points

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjets with both active or latent Myosfascial Trigger Points
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Musculoskeletal problems in the last month
- Surgical interventions in he knee, hip, ankle, back or neck in tha last 6 months
- Psychological or nervous alterations
- Uncomprehension of the study protocol
